Historian Tal Bruttmann's sharp eye on the Holocaust
subhead: In his latest book, the French historian continues his investigation into the photographs taken by the SS in 1944 at Auschwitz – archives that had never been used before – and tirelessly challenges misconceptions about the Holocaust.

Israeli reservists called up to Gaza torn between doubt and duty
subhead: Tens of thousands of reservists have been called up to carry out Israel's ground offensive in Gaza City. A minority have refused, questioning the aims of a war that began two years ago after the attack by Hamas. Others have responded without hesitation.

title: Trump and Xi set to meet as TikTok deal nears resolution
subhead: Following their phone conversation on September 19, the presidents of the United States and China, the world's two leading powers, have signaled a willingness to open dialogue and ease tensions between their countries.

title: Grenoble, Strasbourg and Rennes top France's ranking of bike-friendly cities
subhead: After surveying thousands of riders, cycling advocates on Thursday released their ranking of France's most bike-friendly cities, aiming to shape debate ahead of the 2026 municipal elections.

title: Japan faces a rising wave of xenophobia
subhead: Long resistant to immigration, Japan has witnessed its foreign-born population increase rapidly. This trend has contributed to a sense of insecurity, which has spread on social media and been fueled by politicians who seize on incidents to stoke fear and rejection of foreigners.

The 'One Piece' flag finds its place in protests across France
subhead: The pirate flag from the crew of the famous manga appeared on banners and placards during protests in France on September 18, not only due to its popularity but also because of its political undertones.

title: In Israel, a heated debate over accusations of genocide in Gaza slowly emerges
subhead: For most Israelis, the idea that their army could have committed genocide in Gaza remains unthinkable. But for a few intellectuals, shocked by the scale of the carnage and destruction, this characterization now seems justified.

title: The silent and destructive spread of laughing gas: 'That shit took my whole life'
subhead: A boy barely out of his teens, a man not yet 30, a young nursing assistant, a father: All share how their lives have been shattered by nitrous oxide. This legal, inexpensive and easily accessible substance has become a widely consumed and addictive drug.
